alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 4:15PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Yukon River at Eagle. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible and has a high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water or severe flooding. Large chunks of ice may push overbank. Now is the time to take precautions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Breakup of the Yukon River between Dawson City and the Alcan Border has been dynamic with ice jams forming and releasing. This pattern is expected to continue downriver past Eagle as the breakup front moves by the community. A large ice jam downriver from Dawson City released at 6am today but reformed approximately 20 miles upstream of the Alcan Border. This jam is causing major flooding at the mouth of the Fortymile River in the Yukon Territory. It is estimated at least 12 structures are flooded with water 5 to 7 feet of water. Water levels on the Yukon River have risen over 7 feet since Monday at Eagle and are continuing to steadily increase with intact ice still in place. When the ice jam upriver releases, it is possible additional ice jams and flooding could occur near Eagle. The Yukon River is expected to breakup in Eagle in the next few days. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc/ - If you live near or along Yukon River near Eagle stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor local river conditions and prepare for the possibility of ice jam flooding. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Now is the time to move items to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
